intro: Randia disperma, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. Randia disperma thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of water bodies.
